meanings.definition: A person who writes or sells squibs.
meanings.sent1: The squibbers at the market had a variety of funny jokes for sale.
meanings.sent2: I heard the squibbers at the fair were selling out of their clever puns.
meanings.sent3: The squibbers decided to have a contest to see who could come up with the silliest joke.
meanings.sent4: The squibbers' words were like tiny sparks that lit up the room with laughter.
meanings.sent5: The squibbers' creativity knew no bounds as they crafted witty one-liners.

meanings.definition: A small firework that burns with a hissing noise before exploding.
meanings.sent1: The children were excited to set off the colorful squibbers during the celebration.
meanings.sent2: The squibbers lit up the night sky with their bright colors and crackling sounds.
meanings.sent3: The squibbers added a festive touch to the party with their sparkling display.
meanings.sent4: The squibbers' pops and crackles echoed through the valley, signaling the start of the festivities.
meanings.sent5: The squibbers' dazzling lights mesmerized the crowd as they burst into the air.

meanings.sent1: She squibbers her witty remarks on social media for all to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: He squibbers his humorous anecdotes in a weekly column for the local newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The author decided to squibbers a series of short stories to entertain her readers.
meanings.sent4: Their words squibbers through the air, leaving a trail of laughter in their wake.
meanings.sent5: The comedian squibbers his jokes with perfect timing, always getting a good laugh.
